Metadata: The effect of chronic testosterone administration on sturgeon gonadotropins in juvenile and pre-​vitellogenic white sturgeon ("Acipenser transmontanus")

The present set of experiments was designed to determine if white sturgeon, like rainbow trout, can increase plasma pituitary gonadotropin (GTH) levels in response to chronic testosterone treatment. Testosterone-​treated white sturgeon were also injected with a gonadotropin releasing hormone analog known to induce GTH release in mature male white sturgeon. The effects of this combined treatment on pituitary and plasma concentrations of GTHs were also evaluated.
